nodes.documentation:
@notice     Deletes state after funding
 @dev        This is called when we go to ACTIVE or setup fails without fraud
nodes.name: fundingTeardown

 @dev        This is only called as we transition to setup failed

@notice     Transfers the funders bond to the signers if the funder never funds
 @dev        Called only by notifyFundingTimeout

function (struct DepositUtils.Deposit storage pointer) view returns (address payable)

nodes.documentation:
@notice     Returns the funder's bond plus a payment at contract teardown
 @dev        Returns the balance if insufficient. Always call this before distributing signer payments

 @dev        called only by notifyFraudFundingTimeout

nodes.name: provideBTCFundingProof

createNewDeposit(DepositUtils.Deposit st.details: This should be called by an approved contract, not a developer

notifyFraudFundingTimeout(DepositUtils.D.details: This is not a funder fault. The signers have faulted, so the funder shouldn't fund

notifyFundingTimeout(DepositUtils.Deposi.details: This is considered a funder fault, and we revoke their bond

notifySignerSetupFailure(DepositUtils.De.details: We rely on the keep system punishes the signers in this case

provideBTCFundingProof(DepositUtils.Depo.details: Takes a pre-parsed transaction and calculates values needed to verify funding

params._bitcoinHeaders: Single bytestring of 80-byte bitcoin headers, lowest height first
params._merkleProof: The merkle proof of transaction inclusion in a block
params._txInputVector: All transaction inputs prepended by the number of inputs encoded as a VarInt, max 0xFC(252) inputs
params._txOutputVector: All transaction outputs prepended by the number of outputs encoded as a VarInt, max 0xFC(252) outputs

provideBTCFundingProof(DepositUtils.Depo.return: True if no errors are thrown

provideFraudBTCFundingProof(DepositUtils.details: Takes a pre-parsed transaction and calculates values needed to verify funding

params._bitcoinHeaders: Single bytestring of 80-byte bitcoin headers, lowest height first
params._merkleProof: The merkle proof of transaction inclusion in a block
params._txInputVector: All transaction inputs prepended by the number of inputs encoded as a VarInt, max 0xFC(252) inputs
params._txOutputVector: All transaction outputs prepended by the number of outputs encoded as a VarInt, max 0xFC(252) outputs

provideFraudBTCFundingProof(DepositUtils.return: True if no errors are thrown

provideFundingECDSAFraudProof(DepositUti.details: ECDSA is NOT SECURE unless you verify the digest

params._preimage: The sha256 preimage of the digest
params._signedDigest: The digest signed by the signature vrs tuple

retrieveSignerPubkey(DepositUtils.Deposi.details: We store the pubkey as 2 bytestrings, X and Y.

createNewDeposit(DepositUtils.Deposit st.notice: The system can spin up a new deposit

notifyFraudFundingTimeout(DepositUtils.D.notice: Anyone may notify the contract no funding proof was submitted during funding fraud

notifyFundingTimeout(DepositUtils.Deposi.notice: Anyone may notify the contract that the funder has failed to send BTC

notifySignerSetupFailure(DepositUtils.De.notice: Anyone may notify the contract that signing group setup has timed out

provideBTCFundingProof(DepositUtils.Depo.notice: Anyone may notify the deposit of a funding proof to activate the deposit                             This is the happy-path of the funding flow. It means that we have succeeded

provideFundingECDSAFraudProof(DepositUti.notice: Anyone can provide a signature that was not requested to prove fraud during funding

retrieveSignerPubkey(DepositUtils.Deposi.notice: we poll the Keep contract to retrieve our pubkey
